The 'Thar Desert' (, Hindi:à¤¥à¤¾à¤° à¤®à¤°à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤², , }}, ) also known as the 'Great Indian
Desert') is a large, arid region in the northwestern part of the Indian
subcontinent and forms a natural boundary running along the border between India
and Pakistan. With an area of more than , within the Indian state of Rajasthan,
covering the districts of Jaisalmer, Barmer, Bikaner and Jodhpur, and some
region of the states of Punjab, Haryana and Gujarat. [http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9071941/Thar-
Desert Sahara Desert - Britannica Online Encyclopedia ] it is the world's 18th largest subtropical desert. Dr Mohan La Gupta: Rajasthan Jyankosh, Jojo Granthagar,
Jodhpur, 2008, ISBN 81-86103-05-8, p.69
headings: Water and housing in the desert
